Agents can be dispersed through aerosol droplets released into the air (such as from a plane), ingested through drinks and food supply tampering (food poisoning), put onto surfaces such as statutes (e.g. graffiti) where people can transfer them to their bodies through direct contact (contact transmission), via injection needles deliberately placed in public environments (injection drug users) or inserted into enclosed spaces such as letterboxes so that people come into contact with infected rodent urine droplets containing hantavirus after opening the package (mail service transmission).
